comments.author: cv.schmitt@gmail.com
comments.creator: cv.schmitt@gmail.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

I simply downloaded 7.0.0 and decompressed the package.
All went well in the beginning of firefox 7.0.0


Actual results:

firefox updated to 7.0.1 and then it began to behave strange with graphics.
the tabs have stripes, as if there is an error with the graphics-card.
but graphics-card is not malfunctioned.
I use Debian Squeeze 6.0.0


Expected results:

it looks as if malware installed as java-code into firefox 7.0.1 files ???
some skript-kiddies-code ???
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

I simply downloaded 7.0.0 and decompressed the package.
All went well in the beginning of firefox 7.0.0


Actual results:

firefox updated to 7.0.1 and then it began to behave strange with graphics.
the tabs have stripes, as if there is an error with the graphics-card.
but graphics-card is not malfunctioned.
I use Debian Squeeze 6.0.0


Expected results:

it looks as if malware installed as java-code into firefox 7.0.1 files ???
some skript-kiddies-code ???

Can you attach a screenshot?
Also, there were no changes in Firefox between 7.0 and 7.0.1 that should cause this graphics change.
